bboxes.raw_text:
In announcing his plans to seek
reelection to the Arizona Cor
poration Commission for
second six-year term, A.P.
"Jack" Buzard reaffirms his
pledge made six years ago to
represent all the people without
special privilege or favor and to
serve conscientiously and dill
gently.


The record of achievement of
the Arizona Corporation Com
mission since he took office six
years ago is the best testimony
of his outstanding leadership.


Prudent appropriation budgets
have been submitted to the Legis-
lature of Arizona by the Com
mission and the Legislature has
been most cooperative in per-
uniting ample funds for the Com
missions fluid operation. When
an inquiry was made of Mr..
Buzard as to whispered secrecies
on the part of the Commission,
he pointed out that any issue

Buzurd Seeks Reelection Says
Record Speaks For Him

Girls Of high moral character,
10 years and over are invited
to enter the annual Elks bathing
beauty and talent contest. Con-
tact Dts. Florence Sessions.
Louise Becton or me. Call AL A.
0O72 and leave your name and
address. The contest will be
held IN August.


A shipwreck party will be held
at the lodge hall Sat-, July 81.
81. Mrs. Florence Sessions is
chairman.


Everyone is invited to the open
house at the Elks lodge hall.
1907 S. 9TH Ave., Sat-. July "a,
81.


Remember to the sick. Send
a card, call or visit them. DIT.
Elizabeth Turner remains at
Memorial Hospital ] West #2o.
Bro. Charles Patters on is i'll at
home, l407 E. Coronado.


Elks Reporter


= ArC1aro r,ov

Laundry recipes that nome
makers may clip out and save
are currently being offered for
the first time on the back of all
Surf detergent packages by Lever
Brothers Company. Clip-and-
save recipes have long been a
successful packaging feature for
food products.


The Surf recipes are helpful
laundry hints. Each hint is
printed on an easy-to-file, cut
out card and contains simple
practical instructions for the
laundering and cleaning care Of
various household items.

WASHINGTON, DC. DR.. FL
mer w. Englestrom. president
of Radio Corporation Of America
and DR.. Martin D. Jenkins. presi-
dent of Morgan State College,
Baltimore, emphasized the
national importance of three
day conference to increase the
placement of minority college
graduates in business and
industry.


The conference is being spon-
sored by the Plans for Progress
program of the President Com
mittee on Equal Employment OPP
portunity and the College Place
ment Council, Inc. More than 800
representatives of major cor
porations and predominantly
Negro colleges have registered
for the meeting, July y = "a at
the Statler Hilton Hotel.


DR.. Englestrom said: 1.-THE
interests of America require that
every available talent in the
nation be used to the maximum
and that the development of all
our human reso urces be actively
encouraged.


"This meeting of presidents
and placement directors of pre-
dominantly Negro colleges and
recruitment representatives
from private industry is designed
to further the goal of assuring
to every young American his
place in the nations future. 1t
is a basic step in the inevitable
progression of equal rights from
concept to practical application.


"By assuring our minority COL
leges students equal opportunity
for employment and advance
ment, we are achieving at the
same time a far broader purpose;
we are giving to the present
generation Of school children a
dramatic lesson in how they will
be able to prepare for useful
and constructive role in our
society,""

of a controversial nature affect
ing the people was accorded
public hearing which was open to
the public and the transcripts of
all hearings are made a part
of the public record for all to see.


Mr.. Buzard, with his wife
Margritte, and two daughters,
Carol. age % and Marilyn. age
10, resides at 1884 North 18th
Street in Phoenix.
